javadoc: CheckoutManager manages checkout data for a versioned LocalFolderItem. Checkout data is maintained within the file 'checkout.dat' located within the items data directory.

methods.name: <init>

params.name: create
params.comment:
if true an empty checkout data file is written, else the
            initial data is read from the file.

methods.javadoc: Returns the file which contains checkout data.
methods.name: getCheckoutsFile
methods.comment: Returns the file which contains checkout data.

methods.name: newCheckout
methods.comment: Requests a new checkout for the associated item.

return.comment:
checkout data or null if exclusive checkout denied due to
         existing checkouts.

methods.name: updateCheckout
methods.comment: Update the version associated with the specified checkout

params.name: version
params.comment: item version to be associated with checkout

methods.name: endCheckout
isCheckedOut
methods.comment:
Returns true if the specified version of the associated item is
 checked-out.

params.name: version
params.comment: the specific version to check for checkouts.

methods.javadoc: Returns true if the any version of the associated item is checked-out.
methods.name: isCheckedOut
methods.comment: Returns true if the any version of the associated item is checked-out.

methods.name: getCheckout
methods.comment:
Returns the checkout data corresponding to the specified checkout ID.
 Null is returned if checkout ID is not found.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the checkout data for all existing checkouts of the associated
 item.
methods.name: getAllCheckouts
methods.comment:
Returns the checkout data for all existing checkouts of the associated
 item.

methods.javadoc:
If validationRequired is true and the checkout data file has been
 updated, the checkout data will be re-initialized from the file. This is
 undesirable and is only required when multiple instances of a
 LocalFolderItem are used for a specific item path (e.g., unit testing).
methods.name: validate
methods.comment:
If validationRequired is true and the checkout data file has been
 updated, the checkout data will be re-initialized from the file. This is
 undesirable and is only required when multiple instances of a
 LocalFolderItem are used for a specific item path (e.g., unit testing).

methods.javadoc:
Read data from checkout file.
@throws IOException
methods.name: readCheckoutsFile
parseCheckoutElement
getCheckoutElement

name: CheckoutManager
comment:
CheckoutManager manages checkout data for a versioned
 LocalFolderItem. Checkout data is maintained within the file 'checkout.dat'
 located within the items data directory.
